title: Multiplayer Fundamentals
overview: Understand real-time networking models and authority.
objectives: Why Peer-to-Peer is risky for competitive games

sections.title: Client-Server Model
sections.content:
In this model, the **Server is God**. Clients send inputs (e.g., 'I pressed Right'), and the Server calculates the result and sends back the true state.

**Rule**: Never trust the client.

questions.question: Who calculates the true game state?
questions.explanation: To prevent cheating and sync issues, one source of truth (the server) must exist.

questions.question: What does the client send to the server?
questions.explanation: Sending inputs prevents 'teleport hacks' where a client claims to be somewhere they shouldn't.
